test_cases.claim: 0G Galileo testnet uses Chain ID 16601
0G implements a modular blockchain architecture with four core components
0G uses Proof-of-Stake consensus mechanism
0G Chain is fully compatible with the Ethereum Virtual Machine
0G Network raised $325 million from investors
Eligible testnet validators receive 1,143 tokens in the airdrop
The 0G block explorer is located at https://chainscan-galileo.0g.ai
The native token of 0G Network is called OG
0G Galileo testnet uses Chain ID 1337
0G Network uses Proof-of-Work consensus mechanism
0G Network raised $500 million in funding
Eligible validators receive 2,000 tokens in the airdrop
The 0G block explorer is at https://etherscan.io
The native token of 0G Network is called ZRG
0G is a traditional monolithic blockchain without modular components
The 0G RPC endpoint is https://mainnet.infura.io
0G can process exactly 100,000 transactions per second
0G mainnet will launch on December 15, 2024
0G Network currently has 1,500 active validators
50% of 0G validators are located in North America
The OG token is currently priced at $2.50
0G Network currently stores 500 TB of data
0G Network consumes 100 MW of energy daily
0G has a strategic partnership with Microsoft Azure
0G's modular design allows developers to use individual components without migrating entire applications
0G was specifically designed to handle AI workloads that traditional blockchains cannot support
Existing Ethereum smart contracts can utilize 0G services without code modifications
0G operates on a pay-per-use model for computing resources
Airdrop recipients receive 33.3% of tokens immediately and the rest over 36 months
